THE ROLE OF SHARIAH LAW IN NIGERIAN STATES

Source: United States Department of State, 2006.
Type of Law Number of States (total of 36)
Shariah law applies all cases, including criminal law 9
Shariah law applies in personal status issues only 3
Shariah law plays no role in the judicial system 24

choicesHtml: Nigeria’s system of proportional representation requires that all states allow Muslims access to Shariah law.
Because of Nigeria’s winner-take-all system, states with a Christian majority must allow courts to practice Shariah law.
Nigeria has a federal system, which allows for different systems of laws in different states.
Nigeria has a unitary system, which allows for regional governments to have discretion over when to use Shariah law.
